title: The Amazon KDP Keyword Research Most Beginners Get Wrong

tactics.name: Amazon Bestsellers Filter
tactics.description: Use Amazon's bestseller list with a US address to identify high-traffic keywords
steps: Navigate to Amazon bestsellers best books
Use advanced search to filter keywords
caveats: Address change may fail for non-US users
source_quotes: change address to any US address... click on apply and click on continue

tactics.name: focus_on_independent_publishers
tactics.description: Filter Amazon search results to prioritize books published by independent publishers to identify viable keyword opportunities.
steps: Leave all filters (condition, format, age, language, date) unadjusted
Search within specific categories/subcategories to niche down
caveats: May yield fewer results for niche topics
source_quotes: We want to concentrate on independent publisher. Just watch what I'm going to do now. When you click on bestselling, come over here where you see publisher. What you're going to type here is independently published.

tactics.name: BSR Threshold Selection
tactics.description: Prioritize books with BSR below 20,000 to avoid high competition, using independent publisher data for keyword validation.
steps: Check for 4.4K+ reviews as a minimum threshold
Select niches like internet/social media or business technology
caveats: Avoid books with BSR above 20,000 without advanced keyword research
source_quotes: I would tell you not to work on a book that is above 20,000
Make sure that your BSR is like 20,000 down

tactics.name: Keyword Extraction and BSR Analysis
tactics.description: Identify sit keywords and analyze BSR/reviews to avoid high-competition niches
steps: Copy sit keyword from target book title
Check BSR and review counts using Cape Scout
Avoid books with BSR > 20,000 or >200 reviews
caveats: Avoid copying full titles to prevent account termination
source_quotes: If you dare copy this title word for word, Amazon is going to block your book.

heuristics.name: Review Threshold Boost
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are less than 200, boost keyword potential
source_quotes: you can write 100 books and they'll all sit on Amazon KDP with zero sales

heuristics.name: prioritize_high_volume_keywords
heuristics.condition: If a keyword has high search volume and low competition, prioritize it for title/keyword optimization
source_quotes: These are all the niches that has been published by independent publishers like you and me.

heuristics.name: Review Quantity Heuristic
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are less than 200, prioritize books with higher review counts
source_quotes: Please don't order any book that doesn't have reviews

heuristics.name: Low-Competition Focus
source_quotes: advise that if you're making your own research, make sure that your BSR is from 20,000 down to one.

claims.statement: Proper keyword research is essential for Amazon KDP ranking
source_quotes: if you don't know how to do a proper keyword research... your book will be visible and possibly rank on the first page

claims.statement: Amazon's search functionality allows filtering by publisher type to identify independent publisher content.
source_quotes: You can type independently published on the box. After that, for the subject, leave it in all subject.

claims.statement: Books with BSR above 20,000 require advanced keyword research to be viable
source_quotes: If you don't know how to do a proper keyword research, please and please don't work on a book that is above 20,000

claims.statement: Copying book titles word-for-word may result in account termination
source_quotes: If you dare copy this title word for word, Amazon is going to block your book.

niche_patterns.description: Target specific niches with identity, problem, and constraint elements
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Combines demographic targeting with specific needs and limitations
